gololang.ir

Class AbstractInvocation<T extends AbstractInvocation<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gololang.ir.GoloElement<T>
      • gololang.ir.GoloStatement<T>
        • gololang.ir.ExpressionStatement<T>
          • gololang.ir.AbstractInvocation<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FunctionInvocation, MacroInvocation, MethodInvocation

    public abstract class AbstractInvocation<T extends AbstractInvocation<T>>
extends ExpressionStatement<T>
    Abstract representation of a Golo invocation in the IR tree.

    Used to represent regular function call, method invocation, and macro call.

    Note that the called object is only refereed by its name and not an IR node, since the linkage is done at runtime. There is no guaranty that such an object exists.

      • withArgs

        public T withArgs(java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Defines the values of the arguments for this invocation.

        This is a builder method.

        This methods appends the arguments to the existing ones, so that it can be called multiple times to create the invocation incrementally. On the other hand, it is not idempotent.

        Calls withNamedArguments() if needed.

        Parameters:
        arguments - the arguments of the invocation. An argument can be any GoloElement, or are converted with ExpressionStatement.of(Object) otherwise, so that strings and primitives are automatically wrapped in a ConstantStatement.
        Returns:
        this invocation
        See Also:
        withNamedArguments(), ExpressionStatement.of(Object)

      • getArguments

        public java.util.List<GoloElement<?>> getArguments()

      • getArity

        public int getArity()
        Returns the number or arguments of this invocation.

        It can be different of called object number of parameters if it is a vararg one.

        Since the call is resolved at runtime, there is no guaranty that these two numbers match.

      • usesNamedArguments

        public boolean usesNamedArguments()
        Checks if this call uses the named arguments syntax.

        See the Golo Guide on Named Parameters

      • namedArgumentsComplete

        public boolean namedArgumentsComplete()

      • withNamedArguments

        public T withNamedArguments()
        Mark the invocation as using names arguments syntax.

        This is a builder method.

        This method should not need to be called directly since the withArgs(Object...) one checks its argument and call this one if needed.

        See Also:
        withArgs(Object...)

      • replaceElement

        protected void replaceElement(GoloElement<?> original,
                              GoloElement<?> newElement)
        Replace a child.

        Replace original with newElement if original is a child of this node and type matches.

        Specified by:
        replaceElement in class GoloElement<T extends AbstractInvocation<T>>
        Parameters:
        original - the original value to replace. Must be a child of this node
        newElement - the element to replace with. Type must match.
        See Also:
        GoloElement.cantReplace(), GoloElement.cantReplace(GoloElement, GoloElement), GoloElement.doesNotContain(GoloElement), GoloElement.cantConvert(String, Object)
